data.text:
John A. and Charlotte L. Barker OBITUARY

On May 15, 2023 at age 93, John Adolph Barker, formerly of St. Clair Shores, Michigan passed away in Rochester, Michigan surrounded by his loving children Debra Barker Turnbow, Philip Barker, and David Barker. His wife Charlotte and their son Steven Barker preceded him in death. Grandchildren include Sarah Turnbow Halpin, Lacey Turnbow, Charlotte Turnbow, Lisa Karaczewski, Nicholas Barker, Emily Barker and five great grandchildren. John was predeceased by parents Paul P. Barker (Barkowski) and Laura Pohl Barker, and his siblings Paul L. Barker, Charlotte Barker and Theodosia Therssen.

At 89 years of age, Charlotte Louise Harrison Barker, formerly of St. Clair Shores, Michigan, passed away on June 3, 2017 in Troy, Michigan. John and Charlotte were wed in 1951 at St. Gertrude Church in Saint Clair Shores, Michigan. Charlotte’s parents were Grover Everett Harrison and Clara Herzler Harrison. Charlotte was the fifth of six children, and is predeceased by her siblings William Harrison, David Harrison, Thomas Harrison, Grover Harrison, Irene Kozak. Charlotte, a homemaker, cared for their special needs son Steve. Charlotte enjoyed cooking, gardening and water color painting.

As a teenager, John enjoyed working at his father’s farm tending to the fields, harvesting and feeding livestock. He also worked at his father’s business National Production Company working with machine tools, engineering, tool making, metal work and in distribution of product. John served in the Armed Forces of the United States – U.S. Naval Reserve from 1948 through 1956 aboard the USS Missouri and teaching classes for skilled trades and machine tools to enlisted service personnel at the Detroit Light Guard Armory. In 1956 John’s wife Charlotte encouraged him to start his own business Power Equipment Shop which became Power Equipment Distributors, Inc. John built the business from a retail sales and service operation into a full scale wholesale distribution company for lawn and garden products with over 50 employees, selling equipment and parts to thousands of dealerships throughout the Mid-West. John sold the business to his employees and retired in 1984 at age 55. John’s hobbies included, hunting, fishing, wood working and teaching people mechanical trade skills.

In retirement, John and Charlotte loved to motor home travel through the United States and loved the warmer winter climates of the South-West. John, Charlotte and Steven devoted their time and delivery services to Goodwill Industries, Las Vegas, NV and to Lighthouse Outreach, Roseville, MI. In 2017, John joined the Sunrise Assisted Living community. John loved and appreciated the staff and fellow residents and was known for his jokes, pleasant demeanor, working puzzles and card games. John will be missed by all who knew and loved him.

Funeral Mass will be held on Saturday, August 19, 2023 – 11:30am. The family will receive friends at 11:00am until time of service. Graveside service will be held afterward at 1:00pm at Resurrection Cemetery, Clinton Township, MI.
